abstract: At the E3 game conference in Santa Monica this week, Nintendo continued to be in unaccustomed role of 800 pound gorilla. The popularity of its Wii platform prompted a price cut by Sony. And Microsoft was reeling after admitting that there were defects in many of its Xbox 360 systems.
lead_paragraph: At the E3 game conference in Santa Monica this week, Nintendo continued to be in unaccustomed role of 800 pound gorilla. The popularity of its Wii platform prompted a price cut by Sony. And Microsoft was reeling after admitting that there were defects in many of its Xbox 360 systems.
